definition:
The real function $f$ is [*continuous from the left*]{} in the point
$x = x_0$ iff $$\lim_{x\to x_0-}f(x) = f(x_0).$$

The real function $f$ is [*continuous from the right*]{} in the point
$x = x_0$ iff $$\lim_{x\to x_0+}f(x) = f(x_0).$$

The real function $f$ is [*continuous on the closed interval*]{}
$[a,\,b]$ iff it is continuous at all points of the open interval
$(a,\,b)$, from the right continuous at $a$ and from the left continuous
at $b$.\
**Examples.** The ceiling function $\lceil{x}\rceil$ is from the left
continuous at each integer, the mantissa function
$x\!-\!\lfloor{x}\rfloor$ is from the right continuous at each integer.
